item.title: Cak2 add a quote by Jose Ortega y Gasset
item.description: "The metaphor is probably the most fertile power possessed by man" -- Jose Ortega y Gasset

item.title: Cak2 add a quote by Italo Calvino
item.description: "The city, however, does not tell its past, but contains it like the lines of a hand" -- Italo Calvino

item.title: Cak2 add a quote by Irina Dunn
item.description: "A woman needs a man like a fish needs a bicycle." -- Irina Dunn

item.title: Cak2 add a quote by Paul McCartney
item.description: "And, in the end The love you take is equal to the love you make." -- Paul McCartney

item.title: Cak2 add a quote by Salman Rushdie
item.description: "From the beginning men used God to justify the unjustifiable." -- Salman Rushdie

item.title: Cak2 add a quote by Umberto Eco
item.description: "Absence is to love as wind is to fire: it extinguishes the little flame, it fans the big." -- Umberto Eco

item.title: Cak2 add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "And, when you want something, all the universe conspires in helping you to achieve it." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Cak2 add a quote by Salman Rushdie
item.description: "Fundamentalism isn't about religion, it's about power." -- Salman Rushdie

item.title: Cak2 add a quote by Salman Rushdie
item.description: "faith without doubt is addiction" -- Salman Rushdie

item.title: Cak2 add a quote by Salman Rushdie
item.description: "Whores and writers, Mahound. We are the people you can't forgive." -- Salman Rushdie

item.title: Cak2 add a quote by Salman Rushdie
item.description: "Memory has its own special kind. It selects, eliminates, alters, exaggerates, minimizes, glorifies, and vilifies also; but in the end it creates its own reality, its heterogeneous but usually coherent version of events; and no sane human being ever trusts someone else's version more than his own." -- Salman Rushdie

item.title: Cak2 add a quote by Salman Rushdie
item.description: "A book is not completed till it's read." -- Salman Rushdie

item.title: Cak2 add a quote by Salman Rushdie
item.description: "A photograph is a moral decision taken in one eighth of a second. " -- Salman Rushdie

item.title: Cak2 add a quote by Salman Rushdie
item.description: "Nothing comes from nothing, Thieflet; no story comes from nowhere; new stories are born from old--it is the new combinations that make them new." -- Salman Rushdie

item.title: Cak2 add a quote by Salman Rushdie
item.description: "You can't judge an internal injury by the size of the hole." -- Salman Rushdie

item.title: Cak2 add a quote by Salman Rushdie
item.description: "If love is a yearning to be like (even to become) the beloved, then hatred, it must be said, can be engendered by the same ambition, when it cannot be fulfilled." -- Salman Rushdie

item.title: Cak2 add a quote by Salman Rushdie
item.description: "A poet's work . . . to name the unnamable, to point at frauds, to take sides, start arguments, shape the world and stop it from going to sleep." -- Salman Rushdie

item.title: Cak2 add a quote by Salman Rushdie
item.description: "Is birth always a fall?" -- Salman Rushdie

item.title: Cak2 add a quote by Umberto Eco
item.description: "I have come to believe that the whole world is an enigma, a harmless enigma that is made terrible by our own mad attempt to interpret it as though it had an underlying truth." -- Umberto Eco

item.title: Cak2 add a quote by Umberto Eco
item.description: "What is life if not the shadow of a fleeting dream?" -- Umberto Eco

item.title: Cak2 add a quote by Umberto Eco
item.description: "We were clever enough to turn a laundry list into poetry." -- Umberto Eco

item.title: Cak2 add a quote by Umberto Eco
item.description: "Memory is a stopgap for humans, for whom time flies and what is passed is passed." -- Umberto Eco
